N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 14 ยง 541.7 - Order of transfer

State Regulations
(a) A defendant in
a secure facility, pursuant to a retention order or a recommitment order, may
not be transferred to a nonsecure facility unless the court that issued the
commitment order or recommitment order, or a superior court in the county in
which the secure facility is located, issues a transfer order. (b) The Director of Forensic Services may
apply for a transfer order upon the recommendation of the clinical director, after consultation with the hospital forensics committee, in accordance with
the procedures described in section
541.9
of this Part. The
application shall be made on forms jointly adopted by the commissioner and the

Office of Court Administration and shall be accompanied by a current
psychiatric report. The Director of Forensic Services shall give written notice
of the application to the district attorney, the defendant, the counsel for the
defendant and the Mental Health Information Service. (c) The application and psychiatric report
shall contain facts and opinions to substantiate the view that the defendant
does not have a dangerous mental disorder or that, consistent with the public
safety and welfare of the community and the defendant, the clinical condition
of the defendant warrants transfer from a secure facility to a nonsecure
facility. (d) The application shall
contain the name and address of the nonsecure facility under the jurisdiction
of the commissioner to which the defendant would be transferred, and shall
include recommendations of conditions which would be necessary and
appropriate. (e) The treatment team
leader or a psychiatrist or psychologist familiar with the defendant's current
mental condition and case history shall be prepared to testify in support of
the application for a transfer order. (f) If the court issues a transfer order, the

Director of Forensic Services shall transfer the defendant to the nonsecure
facility designated on the application, or to a nonsecure facility designated
in the transfer order, if different. The defendant's clinical records and
copies of all court orders shall be transferred with him. The conditions
contained in the order of conditions issued in conjunction with the transfer
order shall be observed. Notes
